Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <zpajk> Create a zs address or use one from earlier in Receive tab. Copy the address. Go to Send tab and choose 'Shield all recent coinbase transactions'. Paste the copied address in the 'Send to' field, then press 'Shield funds' button, and confirm.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <c2k> gotcha. thanksüëä

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <zpajk> Once you gotten at least 1 block confirmation of that transaction you can send it back to a transparent address for staking or whatever. But the important part is that you have to wait for at least 1 confirmation to continue transferring those funds.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <zpajk> btw, 0.5.5 had some staking issues, where it would stop staking when transferring funds to private addresses. You might want to upgrade, depending on your needs. 0.5.6 has been available for a long time. I'd recommend upgrading, but I can't stress enough about the importance of backing up your wallet on a regular basis, at least before upgrading Agama.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <SmeLLyArMpiTs> @zpajk  if I may ask .. is there any commands or means to confirm that I am staking it right? I just feel very vulnerable seeing staking = true but nothing coming in  haha

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <zpajk> @SmeLLyArMpiTs I know the feeling. I've expressed my trust issues for the staking earlier, but every Agama version so far has indicated that "Staking: true" is accurate.
Another option is to look at ``%appdata%\Komodo\VRSC\debug.log`` and scroll to the bottom. The timestamp might be off due to GMT differences, but look at the "height=" parameter stated and the regular phrase ``Searched for eligible staking transactions, no winners found``.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <zpajk> Using cli command ``listunspent`` you should be able to see all the transactions you're staking.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <Oink> The cli command `getmininginfo` will show you your staking status...
(I feel a guide coming on CLI commands and how to apply them when you installed the GUI wallet...)

Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Oink> My google translate tells me it reads `True power can not be bought` in Latin...

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <Thoskk> @Draeth  When translated into English, the Latin means "True virtue can be will buy" (no typo here).  And it doesn't even catch all, because "virtus" is a female noun, but "verus" a male adjective. English language doesn't care about gender, other languages do.
The correct Latin phrase should be something like "Virtus vera emere non potest". And the "Verus" is gone...

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Thoskk> not really.

Author: Gateway#3763
